refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Amcheck runs a number of self-checks on both the Amanda tape server host and the Amanda client hosts.
On the tape server host, amcheck can go through the same tape checking used at the start of the nightly amdump run to verify the correct tape for the next run is mounted.
Amcheck can also do a self-check on all client hosts to make sure each host is running and that permissions on filesystems to be backed up are correct.
You can specify many host/disk expressions, only disks that match an expression will be checked. All disks are checked if no expressions are given.

See the
man page for more details about Amanda.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.variablelist:
-s
Run the tape server local and tape checks (same as -lt).
-c
Run the client host checks. Multiple specific clients can be checked by specifying the client name.
-l
Run the local tests (e.g. permissions) on the server host.
-t
Run the tape tests on the server host.
-w
Enables a DESTRUCTIVE check for write-protection on the tape (which would otherwise cause the subsequent amdump to fail). If the tape is writable, this check causes all data after the tape label to be erased. If the autolabel option is enabled, this check may ERASE any non-Amanda tape in the drive or changer. The check enable the tape tests on the server host and is only made if the tape is otherwise correct.
-m
Nothing is printed, but mail is sent if any errors are detected. The mail goes to the mailto address specified in the amanda.conf file or the address value if -M is set.
-a
Like -m but the mail is always sent.
-M address
Mail the report to address instead of the mailto value from amanda.conf. Implies -m.
--client-verbose
Print all client messages.
--exact-match
The host and disk are parsed as exact values
host [disk]*
Specify the host and disk on which the command will work.
&configoverride.varlistentry;

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.para: In this example, both the tape server and client tests are run. The results are displayed on standard output.
refsect1.programlisting:
% amcheck daily Amanda Tape Server Host Check ----------------------------- /amanda2/amanda/work: 911475 KB disk space available, that's plenty. NOTE: skipping tape-writable test. Tape VOL10 label ok. Server check took 34.966 seconds.
Amanda Backup Client Hosts Check -------------------------------- WARNING: northstar: selfcheck request timed out. Host down? WARNING: drinkme: selfcheck request timed out. Host down? WARNING: scruffy: selfcheck request timed out. Host down? Client check: 136 hosts checked in 51.945 seconds, 3 problems found.
(brought to you by Amanda 2.5.0)
refsect1.para: In this example, if the line mailto csd-amanda is in amanda.conf, mail will be sent to csd-amanda if the server check returns an error.

varlistentry.term: fatal slot slot: error message

listitem.para: (error) The tape changer detected some kind of fatal error while trying to load slot slot.

varlistentry.term: slot slot: error message

listitem.para: (warning) The tape changer detected some kind of non-fatal error (e.g. an empty slot was detected) while trying to load slot slot, or an error was detected trying to read the tape label.

varlistentry.term: slot slot: date YYYYMMDD label label (result)

listitem.para: (info) Tape label in slot slot was loaded and found to have been last written on YYYYMMDD. If the tape is new, the date field will be an X. The result may be one of:

varlistentry.term: exact label match

listitem.para: This is the expected tape.

varlistentry.term: no match

listitem.para: This label does not match the labelstr pattern in amanda.conf. Tape scanning will continue.

varlistentry.term: active tape

listitem.para: This tape is still active and cannot be overwritten. Tape scanning will continue.

varlistentry.term: first labelstr match

listitem.para: This tape is the first one that matches the labelstr pattern in amanda.conf. Tape scanning will continue if necessary.

varlistentry.term: labelstr match

listitem.para: This tape is the next one that matches the labelstr pattern in amanda.conf. Tape scanning will continue.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: cannot look up dump user user

listitem.para: (error) Dump user user from amanda.conf could not be found in the system password information.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: cannot look up my own uid (uid)

listitem.para: (error) User id uid running amcheck could not be found in the system password information.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: running as user runuser instead of dumpuser

listitem.para: (error) Amcheck should be run as the dump user dumpuser from amanda.conf instead of runuser.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: program dir directory: not accessible

listitem.para: (error) The directory Amanda expects to find its auxiliary programs in, directory, is not accessible.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: program program: does not exist

listitem.para: (error) Program program needed on the tape server could not be found.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: program program: not a file

listitem.para: (error) Program program needed on the tape server exists but is not a file.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: program program: not executable

listitem.para: (error) Program program needed on the tape server exists but is not executable.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: program program: not setuid-root

listitem.para: (warning) Program program needed on the tape server exists but should be owned by user "root" and setuid.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: XXX dir directory: not writable

listitem.para: (error) Directory directory is either not writable, i.e. the dump user will not be able to create or remove files, or cannot be accessed, perhaps because a parent directory does not allow search permission. The XXX may be:

varlistentry.term: log

listitem.para: for the Amanda log directory (see logdir in amanda.conf)

varlistentry.term: oldlog

listitem.para: for the directory that holds the old log files (see logdir in amanda.conf)

varlistentry.term: info

listitem.para: for an Amanda database information directory (see curinfo in amanda.conf) or

varlistentry.term: index

listitem.para: for an Amanda index directory (see indexdir in amanda.conf)

varlistentry.term: tapelist

listitem.para: for the &tapelist;

varlistentry.term: NOTE: XXX dir directory: does not exist

listitem.para: (info) A database (info) or index directory does not exist or cannot be accessed. This might just mean this is a new client or disk, but if that is not the case, this should be treated as an error.

varlistentry.term: NOTE: it will be created on the next run

listitem.para: (info) This indicates the info directory listed in the previous message will be created on the next run.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: XXX dir name: not a directory

listitem.para: (error) Amcheck expected name to be a directory, but it is something else (e.g. file).

varlistentry.term: WARNING: info file file: does not exist

listitem.para: (warning) File file does not exist in the text format database. Since the parent directories do exist, the file should already have been created.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: info file name: not a file

listitem.para: (error) Amcheck expected name to be a file, but it is something else (e.g. file).

varlistentry.term: ERROR: info file file: not readable

listitem.para: (error) The text format database file file is not readable.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: log file file: not writable

listitem.para: (error) Log file file (file log in logdir from amanda.conf) is either not writable, or cannot be accessed, perhaps because a parent directory does not allow search permission.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: tape list tapelist: not writable

listitem.para: (error) &tapelist; is not writable or was not found.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: tape list tapelist: parse error

listitem.para: (error) &tapelist; could not be read or parsed.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: tapedev is /dev/null, dumps will be thrown away

listitem.para: (warning) The tapedev parameter in amanda.conf is set to /dev/null and Amanda uses that when debugging to throw all the dump images away.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: hold file file exists

listitem.para: (info) Hold file file exists and will cause amdump to pause at the beginning until it is removed.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: holding disk disk: statfs: error message

listitem.para: (error) An error was returned from the statfs system call on holding disk disk (maybe because it does not exist).

varlistentry.term: ERROR: holding disk disk: not writable

listitem.para: (error) Holding disk disk, is not writable, probably because the caller does not have write permission or a parent directory does not allow search permission.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: holding disk disk: available space unknown N KB requested.

listitem.para: (warning) Amcheck could not determine the amount of available space on holding disk disk to see if there were at least N KBytes available.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: holding disk disk: only F KB free (R KB requested).

listitem.para: (warning) amanda.conf requested R KBytes of free space on holding disk disk, but only F KBytes were available. 10 MBytes is subtracted for each backup process (see the inparallel amanda.conf option) to allow for unexpected overruns.

note.para: Even though this message is listed as a warning, it causes &amcheck; to exit with a non-zero status.

varlistentry.term: Holding disk disk: N KB disk space available, that's plenty.

listitem.para: (info) There was sufficient free space on holding disk disk.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: holding disk disk: only F KB free, using nothing

listitem.para: (warning) Holding disk disk has F KBytes of free space, but that is not enough for what is requested in amanda.conf.

varlistentry.term: Holding disk disk: F KB disk space available, using U KB

listitem.para: (info) Holding disk disk has F KBytes of free space and Amanda will be using up to U Kbytes.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: if a tape changer is not available, runtapes must be set to 1.

listitem.para: (warning) The runtapes amanda.conf option must be set to 1 if the tpchanger amanda.conf option is not set.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: error message.

listitem.para: (error) An error was detected while initializing the tape changer.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: tape device: error message.

listitem.para: (error) An error was detected while processing the tape label.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: cannot overwrite active tape label.

listitem.para: (error) Tape label is still active and cannot be used.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: label label doesn't match labelstr pattern .

listitem.para: (error) The label on tape label does not match the labelstr amanda.conf option.

varlistentry.term: (expecting a new tape)

listitem.para: (info) The tape is not OK and a new tape was expected.

varlistentry.term: (expecting tape label or a new tape)

listitem.para: (info) The tape is not OK and either tape label or a new tape was expected.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: tape label label ok, but is not writable.

listitem.para: (error) Tape label is OK, but the write enable test failed.

varlistentry.term: Tape label is writable.

listitem.para: (info) Tape label is OK and the write enable test succeeded.

varlistentry.term: NOTE: skipping tape-writable test.

listitem.para: (info) The tape write test (see the -w option) was not enabled.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: skipping tape test because amdump or amflush seem to be running
WARNING: if they are not, you must run amcleanup

listitem.para: (warning) It looked to amcheck like either amdump or amflush were running because a log file or amdump file exists. If they are not running, you probably need to run amcleanup to clear up a previous failure. Otherwise, you need to wait until they complete before running amcheck.

varlistentry.term: NOTE: skipping tape checks

listitem.para: (info) The tape tests are being skipped because you used the -t command line option.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: compress is not executable, server-compression and indexing will not work

listitem.para: (warning) Compression program compress is not executable, so compression on the tape server host and creating index files will not work.

varlistentry.term: Tape label label ok.

listitem.para: (info) Tape label is OK for the next run.

varlistentry.term: Server check took S seconds.

listitem.para: (info) Reports how long the tape server host checks took.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: host: could not resolve hostname

listitem.para: (error) Could not look up client hostname host.

varlistentry.term: Client check: H hosts checked in S seconds, N problems found.

listitem.para: (info) Reports the number of client hosts checked, how long it took and the number of errors detected.

varlistentry.term: WARNING: host: selfcheck request timed out. Host down?

listitem.para: (warning) There was no response from host when trying to do the client checks. The host might really be down or it might not be configured properly.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: host NAK: message

listitem.para: (error) Host reported a negative acknowledgment error of message to the status check request.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: host NAK: [NAK parse failed]

listitem.para: (error) Amcheck could not parse the negative acknowledgment error from host. There might be an Amanda version mismatch between the host running amcheck and host.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: host [mutual-authentication failed]

listitem.para: (error) Kerberos authentication failed while contacting host.

varlistentry.term: ERROR: host: message

listitem.para: (error) Error message was reported by the status check on host.

refentry.refsect1:
EXIT CODE The exit code of amcheck is one of:
0 = success 1 = error
